Responses to open text questions


Web Site: Curtin University
Date of Analysis: August 08, 2020
Number of Responses Analysed: 17

Return to Summary Page



Is there anything you think is missing from this web site?
Respondent ID Comment
1 They should have a comprehensive navigation bar on top in the cs homepage. It is difficult to find information for prospective students
2 no
3 Finding professors by field of research seems to be difficult
4 The organization of the website is unusual than what I used before. I suppose that the department of faculty information should be placed in a significant position, especially for the prospective students. However, I found it at the end of the webpage.
5 navigation through the website can be easier
6 Need separate website for all departments.
7 It was hard for me to search the keypoints that I was looking for.
8 It is so hard for prospective students to find admission information. It seems like filled with all kinds of advertisement(how their students think of this university, how this university hold events, how fancy their buildings are). There is no direct way to find out the admission part.
9 they have provided a course search toolbar on top which is not very useful, rather giving a click link to all academics would be more helpful. Professors list cannot be found categorised by department. Also application deadlines are not clearly given only other things are given under the section to apply.
10 Many links are apparent, you have to try hard to find them.
11 A site map or a proper layout. More navigation items and a current page indicator.
12 all the departments are jumbled together in the same site. each of them should have separate site I guess.
13
14 simplicity
15 mahdijaf@yahoo.com
16 No
17 nope

How to read the table

The table on this page displays actual unedited comments each respondent made to the open question. If blank, no comment was made. The best way of looking at them is to read the comments and notice themes which occur regularly.


Content Analysis service at WAMMI.COM

WAMMI provides a popular additional service where respondents comments are sorted into a mangeable number of categories and presented according to percentage distribution and global usability scores. Examples of comments for each category are given in a written report. Please contact us for information about our Content Analysis Service.
